title: Matt Haig - The Humans
description:
Body-snatching has never been so heartwarming . . .

The Humans is a funny, compulsively readable novel about alien abduction, mathematics, and that most interesting subject of all: ourselves. Combine Douglas AdamsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s irreverent take on life, the universe, and everything with a genuinely moving love story, and you have some idea of the humor, originality, and poignancy of Matt HaigÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s latest novel.

Our hero, Professor Andrew Martin, is dead before the book even begins. As it turns out, though, he wasnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t a very nice man--as the alien imposter who now occupies his body discovers. Sent to Earth to destroy evidence that Andrew had solved a major mathematical problem, the alien soon finds himself learning more about the professor, his family, and Ã¢â‚¬Å“the humansÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ than he ever expected. When he begins to fall for his own wife and son--who have no idea heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not the real Andrew--the alien must choose between completing his mission and returning home or finding a new home right here on Earth
